links.displaytext: Stage One: Take off to Site Start Budget (SSB)

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

slidetranscripts.Text:
Stage One: Take off to Site Start Budget (SSB)

Stage overview

The set up of the budget involves both buyers and surveyors to different degrees, both must work together to produce an accurate budget and orders driven from the BoQ. This workbook will take you through a series of examples to develop your understanding.

Feedback required

You will find a number of questions posed during the workbook. Please log your thoughts as you work through this way you wont lose any feedback or ideas to improve!

At the end of the stage you will be asked to complete a few questions via a short on-line survey. As you know your feedback is vitally important to the project so please do take the time to have your say.

Key changes or benefits

This section is an area where key changes are being implemented. There are some fundamental differences to our current approach.

You are likely to spend the same amount of time stacking up your bills as you currently do in iComs but there are some wider benefits:

· Bills drive the update of your VAP budget and ultimately your CVR

· Bills drive the orders

· Using the COINS bills we can pull in Group Deal material prices

The above provide efficiency benefits and well as accurate reporting particularly for the valuation process

Take off to Site Start Budget (SSB)

1.2 Upload BoQ

GTO upload into the divisions. The core housetype list is held at the Standard Housetype BoQ Workbench. The Surveyor will then need to copy the housetype down to the development level.

The Standard Housetype BoQ Workbench will hold both the Group housetypes as well as the what we would currently refer to as the allocation bills, namely: Externals, Overheads, Marketing and Maintenance bills.

Standard templates for the non-sellable bills, as we would refer to as allocation budgets are held as we as standard housetype lists applicable to the division.
